Start with something simple, like parking in the far corner of the parking lot -- so you get extra steps to the door. Take the stairs one or two flights instead of the elevator. If you take public transportation get off one stop early and walk the rest. Get out at lunch to walk. Or walk with your significant other or your spouce after work. You\'ll get a bonus -- relaxation and stress reduction.
It is time for your visit!
Click the button below to start your appointment.If your call is interrupted or dropped for any reason, the provider willcal, you back at the number you entered.

Important: By requesting an appointment, we will attempt to contact the requested provider on your behalf to schedule an appointment. The request does not guarentee an appointment, and the time of the appointment is subject to the provider\'s availability.

Connection Time Out. Please check your network connection or try again later. If the problem persist, please call the MDLIVE Helpdesk at 1-888-995-2183.
The reason the enemies in the game Angry Birds are pigs is because the swine flu epidemic was going around at the time of the game\'s development.

The reason your lungs feel refreshed when walking through a pine forest is because of an anti-inflammatory compound called a-Pinene, found in conifers (Pine trees). It is even used as a bronchodilator in the treatment of asthma.
The human body produces an average of 25 million new each second. That\'s a little less than the population of Canada - every second!
In one square inch of our hands we have nine feet of blood vessels, 600 pain sensors, 9000 nerve endings, 36 heat sensors and 75 pressure sensors.
An adult human body has an average of 5.6 liters (6 quarts) of blood. These 5.6 liters of blood circulates through the body three times every minute.
Your heart will pump about 1 million barrels of blood during your lifetime. That\'s enough to fill 2 oil super tankers.
There are more bacteria in your mouth than the human population of the United States and Canada combined.
Women blink nearly twice as much as men.
Your left lung is smaller than the right lung to make room for the heart.
An adult has fewer bones than a baby. We start off life with 350 bones, but because bones fuse together during growth, we end up with only 206 as adults.
Viruses are usually around 100 times smaller than bacteria.
The femur, or thighbone, is the longest and strongest bone of the human skeleton.
The stapes, in the middle ear, is the smallest and lightest bone of the human skeleton.
The only bone in your body not connected to another is the hyoid, a V-shaped bone located at the base of your tongue.
The first heart pacemakers plugged into a wall socket
Your heart is about the size of your two hands clasped together.
A woman’s average heartbeat is faster than a man’s by almost 8 beats a minute.
During your lifetime, you will produce enough saliva to fill two swimming pools.
Your eyes are always the same size from birth but your nose and ears never stop growing.
Your nose has the ability to remember 50,000 different scents.
The air from a sneeze can travel at speeds of 100 mph or more.
Your eyes are always the same size from birth (but your nose and ears never stop growing).
Ketchup was used as a medicine in the 1800s to treat diarrhea, among other things.
Ortharexia Nervosa is an eating disorder where the sufferer is obsessed with eating healthy food.
A medium-size carrot has 25 calories, 6 grams of carbs, 2 grams of fiber and zero fat content.
The word “health\” comes from the Anglo-Saxon term ”hal", meaning “wholeness.”
Minerals like calcium, iron, and sodium constitute 4% of your body weight. Unlike carbohydrates, fats, and proteins, they do not furnish energy.
Eggs contain the highest quality food protein known. All parts of an egg are edible, including the shell, which has high calcium content.
Humans smell “in stereo.” Scent signals from each nostril travel to different regions in the brain. This may help a person determine the direction the odor is coming from.
You will see your visit history here.
The following provider(s) have access to your medical records
No compitable app found to handle the feature.
The MDLive App lets you have a virtual doctor\'s appointment from your smart phone, 24/7/365. mdlive.com/getapp
MDLIVE requires that users confirm their E-mail address before they can use E-mail features.This helps to prevent problems with bad addresses or spam.
